title.rendered: Employer Engagement Program by Metro Cash and Carry Mall

content.rendered:
An Employer Engagement Program was organized for the STeP students of centre Amba Foundation, Delhi on 30th November 2016. Total of 28 students participated in the program. Mr. Kamal Deep Chandel, HR Consultants, Mr. Surender Sharma, HR Manager and Anuj Chaturvedi, Food Manager from Metro Cash & Carry Mall was invited to impact the importance of skill development training.

Mr. Surender Sharma shared the experience of working in this sector. He gave some important points related to sales and ratail management and he also motivated and urged the students to step their career in retail sector. Mr. Kamal explained about the job opportunities and job description in the mall.

After the program, students gained meaningful knowledge about retail sector.They also observed insights about how a retail sector works and how they should work on their weakness as well as their strength to crack the interview. The program was very informative and it helped the students to get enlightened about the ways processes happen in the manufacturing industry.
